topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the HP DCN VSC Patch

body.p: This patch must be applied only after the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is fully deployed for the Tahoe, Memphis and Sacramento cloud topologies.
Note: This patch is nor required for the Denver topology.
body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the HCG_2.0_DCN002_Patch006 file and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the deploy.yml, vsc_singledisk.qcow2 and Readme-post-deploy.txt files are available.

section.title: Install the patch
section.p: The process for installing this patch is different for highly-available (HA) and non-HA environments. Follow the procedure appropriate for your environment:

section.title: Deploy into a highly-available deployment
section.p: A highly-available VSC environment will have two VSC controllers, one active and one stand-by. For highly-available deployments:

ol.li: Execute the following command to backup the VSC configuration file: scp admin@<vsc ip>:/config.cfg <destination directory>

Log into the lifecycle manager VM. ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.

p.b: Replace the QCOW and YML files with the new files

section.p: Use the following steps to replace the QCOW and YML files on the HLM VM with new versions of the files that you downloaded in the patch file.
Note: If the path to the /base/ directory is different than the default, see Locating the base directory for a command to locate /base/.

ol.li: On the HLM VM, replace the existing vsc_singledisk.qcow2 in the ~/dcn/ directory with the vsc_singledisk.qcow2 you downloaded.
Change to the /opt/share/hlm/1/ansibleconfig/roles/DCN-VSC/tasks directory.
Backup the deploy.yml by copying the file to a new extension that is not YML For example: cp deploy.yml deploy.yml.ORIG
Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/ansible/roles/DCN-VSC/tasks directory.
Backup the deploy.yml by copying the file to a new extension that is not YML For example: cp deploy.yml deploy.yml.ORIG

Replace deploy.yml files you backed-up with the deploy.yml file you downloaded with the patch in both locations. /opt/share/hlm/1/ansibleconfig/roles/DCN-VSC/tasks /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/ansible/roles/DCN-VSC/tasks
Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/ansible/ directory.
Backup the deploy-CCP-T1.yml by copying the file to a new extension that is not YML For example: cp deploy-CCP-T1.yml deploy-CCP-T1.yml.ORIG

section.p: If you do not know the names of your DCN host systems, use the following steps to retrieve the hostnames:
Note: If the path to the /base/ directory is different than the default, see Locating the base directory for a command to locate /base/.

ol.li: Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/ansible/ directory.

Retrieve the hostnames of each of the DCN hosts from hosts file from the hosts file.
For example: BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM and BASE-CCP-T1-M2-NETCLM

section.p: Use the following steps to remove the virtual machine where the VSC is deployed.
Note: If the path to the /base/ directory is different than the default, see Locating the base directory for a command to locate /base/.

ol.li: Login to DCN host1. Using the example in the previous step, BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM.
Execute the following commands to remove the VSC VM virsh list --all virsh destroy vsc virsh undefine vsc
Delete vsc_singledisk.qcow2 from /home/images on DCN HOST1.

Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/ansible/ directory. Check for "Additional Info:" section provided at the end of case1 if directory structure is different from default.

Modify the deploy-CCP-T1.yml file as below location of the file:
Edit the hosts value in the file with the host name you retrieved from the hosts file previously. This has to be done in two places in the file:- - accelerate: 'false' gather_facts: 'no' hosts: BASE-CCP-T1 max_fail_percentage: 0 remote_user: cghelion roles: - accelerate-mode sudo: 'yes' tags: - accelerate-mode - Common - FND-IPT - NTP-SVR - DNS-CLI - FND-KVM - DCN-BRG - DCN-RQ1 - DCN-VSC - Conclude - deploy-CCP-T1.yml - accelerate: 'true' accelerate_port: '10001' hosts: BASE-CCP-T1 max_fail_percentage: 0 ...
Execute the following command to deploy the VSC on one the host added in deploy-CCP-T1.yml filehlm deploy -c <cloudname> -t deploy-CCP-T1.yml
After the deployment of VSC on DCN host1 is complete, , SSH to your VSC VM from HLM Host using the DCM IP.

execute the following commads to verify that the VRG, VSD, VRS are listed in the VSC as Functional and in Available status. show vswitch-controller vswitches show vswitch-controller xmpp-server show vswitch-controller vsd

Repeat the steps in this section (Remove the VSC VMs) for DCN host2 to update the deploy-CCP-T1.yml file with hostname of DCN host2. Make sure that previously added hostname is removed and DCN host2 is added.
Example: hosts: BASE-CCP-T1-M2-NETCLM

After the VSC deployment is completed on all hosts, remove the updated deploy-CCP-T1.yml file and restore the original file from backup you created in the previous section.
Retain the new deploy.yml in the lifecycle manager VM at /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/ansible/roles/DCN-VSC/tasks.

section.title: Deploy into a non-highly-available (non-HA) deployment
section.p: A non-highly-available VSC environment (non-HA) will have only one VSC controller (no stand-by). For non-HA deployments:

ol.li: Execute the following command to backup the VSC configuration file: scp admin@<vsc ip>:/config.cfg <destination directory>

Log into the lifecycle manager VM. ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.

section.title: Locating the base directory
section.p: The path to the /base/ directory can different than the default, if the nickname field in the definition.json file was changed to any value other than the default name during cloud deployment.The default path is:

Use the following steps to locate the directory in the lifecycle manager VM:
Change to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud name>/desired_state directory.
Execute the following command:dcntaskloc=$(find . -name DCN-VSC -type d| head -n 1); cd $dcntaskloc/task
The output will indicate the location of the the /base/ directory.
